metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6224 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ecryptfs-setup-swap in eCryptfs does not prevent the unencrypted swap partition from activating during boot when using GPT partitioning on a (1) NVMe or (2) MMC drive, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information via unspecified vectors.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2015-8946.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6224` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ecryptfs-utils - 111-0ubuntu1.1
libecryptfs1 - 111-0ubuntu1.1
python-ecryptfs - 111-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> This issue only occurs when systemd and GPT partitioning is in use on an NVMe or MMC drive

criterions.comment: ecryptfs-utils package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '111-0ubuntu1.1').
